data.title: Sushi not so good
data.text: I came here for sushi and wanted a Japanese to make it. Instead they have Mexicans preparing it so you can understand that the quality is lacking. The hot part of buffet was ok...but I won't be back to this location again.

data.title: Good
data.text:
When the Sushi craving hits, this is the place to go to....Food is good and fresh and even my sushi hating BF finds plenty to eat at Shinju.

The wait staff could be a bit more enthusiastic, a little smile goes a long way......

data.title: Lunch break
data.text: They serve buffet only with 100 more items to choose from sushi shashmi Salad fried item soup deserts and many more.

data.title: Sushi bar, hibachi, buffet
data.text: The sushi bar makes this place worth the experience. The price is a little high, but the food selection makes it worthwile. They have hibachi, a large assortment of sushi (which is very good), and a regular buffet. The price is around $13 for lunch and $25 for dinner.

data.title: Something for everyone
data.text: We have a large family and when everyone is in town it's a great place to go. There's some thing for everyone. Sushi hibachi or Chinese and sea food. They serve so much fish it has to be fresh! The sushi is generic but decent. Most of the time the crabs, clam, shrimp, oysters or combination of these are fresh and good and worth the price. Good hungry!!

data.title: Lunch.
data.text: Foods ok buffet Sushi they have a salad bar dessert bar and hot food buffet too. Plus a hibachi grill  sushi is good but wish they had a bit more different and not into cream cheese in sushi   But 15$ gets you in and out with a tip a bit more

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Great variety at a resonable price. Dinner options include Stone Crab claws and specialty sushi and sashimi rolls.

data.title: Amazing sushi at affordable price!!!!
data.text: Wow... We stumbled upon this place for our date night and were blown away! $22 for sushi buffet?!? We were hesitant about the quality until we tried it. They have Chinese food and hibachi as well. They also have ice cream, fruit, and dessert for those that want it. We will be back with the whole family!

data.title: HOLY ROACHES
data.text: Look out because the roaches may carry your food away if not crawl on your table and join you for a meal. We complained to the workers and they apologized but we had to leave. Horrible experience never to go again.

data.title: Great lunch!
data.text:
Was in the area for lunch, decided to try them and I don't regret it! No line to wait to be seated! Great atmosphere! Great selection of sushi! Also hot cooked food for those who do not eat sushi. 

Will definitely return if I happen to be in the area for lunch again!

data.title: Holy Mackerel!
data.text:
This restaurant has been a favorite of mine and my families for quite some time now. They have been opening more locations and making it easier for us to find one in our area. 
Now, there are those "Faux" Chinese Buffet places that have maybe 3 rolls of sushi.
Shinju, it's like you have died and gone to sushi nirvana. 
What I love most about it, they have all you can eat sashimi as well. This is a rarity because most places want you to fill up with the rice and other stuff. You get your monies worth with just one plate of sashimi. 
I estimate they have about 25 different types of sushi, no hand rolls though, but that's ok. They also have a Chinese area, Hibatchi, Crab Legs, Oysters, Mussels and of course desserts including ice cream which I love because they have Green Tea and Red Bean Ice Cream keeping with Japanese tradition.
I do believe I saw a sign, unfortunately on my way out that they now sell Boba. If I want Boba (Bubble Tea) I usually have to go to N Miami for it. You don't find it in Florida like you can in NY or others places with a Japan Town or China Town.

Give this place a shot. You may think the $20 a pop is too expensive but if you are a true sushi lover, you know that usually 8 pieces can cost 10-15 bucks alone.

I took my nieces and it was great because they tried sushi for the first time while enjoying the other food available to them. 

Oishii Desu!!!!

data.title: Lots of Choices!
data.text: Love the sushi and hibachi choices at Shinju!  This place can get pretty crowded so we like to go early (like right when they open for dinner).  They also have the "typical" sushi buffet items like fried rice, various soups, noodles, and egg rolls.

data.title: Fresh sushi all the time
data.text: We have visited Shinju many times over the years. Sushi always serves fresh seafood. The staff is always friendly. I never had a bad meal at any of their restaurants, especially the one in Davie. You can't go wrong eating here.

data.title: I always eat too much
data.text: A great assortment of sushi and sashimi. A large variety of rolls too.  A great hot buffet tops it off with a hibachi, cook to order, chef.  Save room for dessert - but I don't bother with that...lol!

data.title: Great sushi and hibachi
data.text: My husband and I dine here at least once a month. They have beautiful fresh sushi and my husband loves their made to order hibachi. They have a great assortment of Chinese food, cold oysters, crab legs that they will heat if you ask, desserts including their green tea ice cream which is wonderful and so much more. Their hot tea is perfect and they have a good selection of beer and wine too. If you tell them it's your birthday they will bring you a tiny piece of cake on a huge plate and completely embarrass you with a 3 minute long goofy song over the sound system! Lol, it's really fun to do to the unsuspecting! Really love this place!

data.title: Excellant
data.text: The food at Shinju is excellent but they are overpriced. Their are so many similar Buffets and much lower prices with good food and great choices.

data.title: Great food for the price
data.text: Unlimited sushi, snow crabs, stir fry, good wine by the glass, clean, friendly service. This chain is really taking the Chinese buffet to a another (higher) level. Been back several times. Great for biz dinner as the fixed price lets you know exactly what the bill will be. If you love crabs, ask for them steamed. They're cold on the buffet for you can get them hot if you ask.

data.title: excellent place
data.text: the food its very good. for the prices on the dinner i think can include the sodas. Its my only complaint

data.title: It's OK
data.text: Nothing out of the ordinary at all you can eat Japanese Buffet.  Sushi and Shashimi were good and displayed nicely although a little on the warm side (room temp).  Other Japanese dishes seemed to be OK.  Bill seemed to be on the high side, around $18.00 for the buffet.  I dined there on a Tuesday and figured it would be cheaper.  I didn't see any posted pricing signs.

data.title: GREAT SUSHI CLEAN PLACE!
data.text: We came with a family of 4 and 1 child, we where seated and was brought a high chair rite away, staff was on top of everything, sushi tasted great and we've been to a lot of sushi restaurants, all in all great buffet for the price!
